description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows kernel elevation of privilege vulnerability (CVE-2024-26173), apply the relevant updates based on your system version:

1. Identify your system's Windows version and architecture (x64 or 32-bit).
2. Download and install the appropriate update package from the Microsoft Update Catalog:
   - For Windows 10 (x64/32-bit) versions, use KB5035858.
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2, use KB5035845.
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2, use KB5035845.
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2, use KB5035854.
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2, use KB5035853.
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2, use KB5035853.
3. Restart your system to apply the updates.

**Details**:
This set of updates resolves a kernel elevation of privilege issue that can be exploited in certain scenarios. It is crucial to ensure that you apply the correct update for your specific build to mitigate the risk effectively. For detailed information, please visit the official Microsoft Update links provided.

**Preconditions**:
- Verify your Windows version and architecture before downloading.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the installation.

Update packages can be found here:
- [KB5035845](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035845)
- [KB5035858](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035858)
- [KB5035853](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035853)
- [KB5035854](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035854)
